abstract_ssm: The Pilgrim Laundry photographs consists of six black-and-white photographs (five of which are mounted) showing interior views of the Brooklyn-based Pilgrim Laundry, dating from circa 1910. The photographs show laundry workers (primarily women) on the job using industrial laundry machinery of the period. There is also one view of a cook in the company kitchen preparing food for workers.
